, situated at altitude of 4200 m, approx. 20 km from Kaza and a few km from
Monastery. It's one of the highest inhabited village in the world.
There is a daily bus from

in the afternoon, returning to Kaza from Kibber early in the morning. Sometimes shared jeeps are also available.

value: directions=at the upper end of the village

content=There are some frescoes and a big prayer wheel inside.
content=Marked by prayer flags, this is the spot when the teacher of the Dalai Lama passed away in the 1980s.

Kibber is a perfect place for short treks around the village, including the following:

value: content=a village situated in the opposite slope, across the Parilungbo canyon. In a short time there will be a bridge across the gorge, making the walk shorter but less interesting.
name=a walk to Gete and Tashigang villages
name=a hike up the Dangmachan peak (5157 m)

content=, directly above the village. The hike is very easy, along highland pastures. The main summit is not directly visible from the village however, making the next fragments of the ascent visible only during the hike. Great views of the 6000+ Chau Chau Kang Nilda and Shilla peaks

Start or finish the trek to
There are shops with basic provisions, inculding bottled water, in some of the guesthouses. Otherwise not much to buy.
Some guesthouses have restaurants. Norling Guesthouse offers tasty food.

value: directions=near the entrance to the village
price=150 Rs for a basic room, 350 Rs for a better one with bathroom (hot water from geyser)
content=The best place in Kibber with a friendly owner, good restaurant and a great balcony. Rooms on the 2nd floor have bathrooms. Beer available on request.

A great source of village culture and natural living. Located in the heart of the village. Many comfortable rooms available and some of the most delicious home cooked food in Spiti and beyond.
tashizom guest has nice wooden rooms and yfi hotspot with satellite internet. just go and check.
